channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pavement reduced to half its width, 21st February
item.description:
Overhanging hedge has reduced the pavement (next to the school) to less than half its width, also making social distancing on school drop off difficult.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 15 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 21st February
item.description:
Another deep pothole, on the side leading out of town, again right in the path of cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 188 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole, 21st February
item.description:
Just near the double mini roundabout on the side leading away from town. Very deep and right in the path of cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 161 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedgerow ruined by litter, 21st February
item.description:
Hedgerow is covered in empty and not so empty bottles and plastics all along this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Withybridge Lane, Boddington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and bedding, 21st February
item.description:
Fly tipped mattress and bedding items in lay-by
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Parcel 7424 Old Gloucester Road, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Lights, 21st February
item.description:
All lights are not working at the junction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 46 Christ Church Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip on Whittington Road, 21st February
item.description:
The location is the top end of Aggs Hill near the Cotswold Way entrance but on the right hand side of the road going towards the Burnt Oak Crossroads. A small fly tip has been put there about 2 weeks ago. Please can it be cleared up together with other rubbish along that stretch along the side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole stretch of road, 21st February
item.description:
The location is on the Cheltenham /Whittington road - Cotswold Way part and just before the Burnt Oak Crossroads. For a stretch of about 100 yards through the trees bordering the road - the road has deteriorated badly in an a continuous length of potholes. To avaoid these as some are quite deep - the sides of the road have been used - so this is being damaged as well. Can this stretch be repaired please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt Flytip Metal Debris - Cleeve Common Road, 21st February
item.description:
The location is the Old Quarry Entrance on Cleeve Common Road. A recent Fly tip was partly cleared away but there remains a quantity of metal and debris from where it was burnt. More material has since been put on the site and part of it has gone down the Cotswold Way track. Please can this area be thoroughly cleared up again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New very uneven road surfacing causing house to shake violently, 21st February
item.description:
Some new houses are being built on Gloucester Road and some new uneven surfacing on the main road is causing the house to shake violently when a bus / lorry / truck drives past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 328 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several pot holes, 20th February
item.description:
Several pot holes a few meters from newly resurfaced road (Feb 2021). These potholes have been there for 12+ months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Tudor Close, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole, 20th February
item.description:
A very large area on the top layer of the road has gone on the outbound side of the road near the junction with Armada Close. It has been this way for 4+ years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Mary Rose Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on junction with Mary Rose outbound., 20th February
item.description:
Pothole has been there for many months & is getting bigger and deeper
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Mary Rose Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole now big enough to be repaired, 20th February
item.description:
Previously reported this pot hole twice, but both occasions it has not been classed as requiring repair. Let's hope 3rd time lucky as there are now two potholes appeared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, innsworth lane, 20th February
item.description:
Pothole 15 meters from the zebra crossing towards Innsworth Camp.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 302 Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep indentation in tarmac, 20th February
item.description:
Just as you are about to come off the M5 at J11a going south there is a deep hole in the road. It looks like the earth underneath has sunk. You can see it in the daylight if you know where it is but it’s invisible in the dark. I drive a mini and if I catch if it feels very dangerous and might cause major damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charlie's Way, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole that has the potential to hurt a cyclist or damage a car, 20th February
item.description:
It’s been there at least two weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 404 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned caravan, 20th February
item.description:
Caravan dumped in gateway and partially blocking road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A38, Norton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous tree, 20th February
item.description:
A tree is falling towards the road and is currently only not falling across the carriageway because it is caught on the telephone wires.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slide and other rubbish dumped, 20th February
item.description:
Slide and at least a couple of bags of rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Highgrove Way, Churchdown
